name: Holiday Inn Mansfield-Foxboro Area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Terrific place. Very nice layout, fresh and updated look, great food, fantastic service. Room was perfect - nice and quiet, good size and one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. Everyone in the hotel from front desk to kitchen/restaurant to cleaning staff is very friendly and eager to please. It is clear that customer service is a strong focus and it shows. The pool area is nicely designed and salt water pool is great. Very convenient location in beautiful business area - lots of nice roads for walking/running. Fifiteen minute drive max to Foxboro - Patriot Place/Gillette Stadium. Hope I get to return some day - really enjoyed my stay.
reviews.title: Delightful Stay

reviews.text: We stayed at the Holiday Inn in Mansfield on Thanksgiving eve. We were visiting family locally and had the best experience. The staff was very accomodating and friendly. We had a great room near the pool, which was clean and monitored.
reviews.title: Our stay was relaxing and enjoyable, a great experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We can't wait to go back next year!
reviews.title: Great Customer Service

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed in the hotel for three days while we were here for Parents Weekend at Wheaton College. Service at the hotel was superb, particularly the front desk and the wait staff. The hotel has an impressive fitness center, with a full line of cardio and strength machines as well as racquet ball courts. Also, the bar sells a sold-in-Massachusetts-only beer on tap, Wachusetts, that was excellent. Holiday Inn may be a chain, but it is nice to see that, at least in this case, it supports the local businesses. We will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice staff...Moderate accomodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Remember this is Mansfield...not Boston.
reviews.title: great
Outwardly Beautiful-Looking, But Not So Good Once You Get In.
reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Holiday Inn in Mansfield while attending a Depeche Mode concert. The renovations to the looby and pool areas are beautiful. The Business Center with computer was very helpful...the customer service for the most part, was not.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we checked in, the girl at the front dest overcharged our credit card double, neglecting to realize we had already paid for our room. The Manager had to step in and try to fix it.
reviews.title: Horrible service, Sub par renovations

reviews.text: Yes, the hallways were hot and humid, and trays of old food sat untouched on the floor. After the first day, we moved the one that sat in front of our door aside...where it sat for the remainder of our stay.
reviews.title: People Having Sex in the Hallway!

reviews.text: There was not enough soap (1 tiny bar for sink & shoer?!) or shampoo in the bathroom.
reviews.title: wonderful

reviews.text: We had trouble logging into the in-room WIFI, even after getting the info. fromn the front desk, don't know what the issue was.
reviews.title: I will definitely be back...FANTASTIC STAY!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were given a free room at the Holiday Inn Mansfield/Foxboro for the night of our wedding as we purchased a package from a local country club. After the wedding we stopped by to check in and were given a "suite". The suite had a king bed, pool view with a jacuzzi tub in the room. We were also offered a bottle of champagne in the room. The pool was a bit loud with swimming classes for kids during the evening and I felt like the shades didn't close well enough (i.e. you could see in people's rooms from the pool even when the shades were closed). I'm not sure how much the suite is per night as it was comped but I know regular rooms are usually $125+. For the area, this is a bit pricey considering there are cheaper options a couple miles down the road. I suppose they can charge more since they are in a business park. Overall, I'd stay again for a discount rate or in a pinch. It was clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Overpriced for the area

reviews.text: This is a suposedly pet friendly hotel. Unfortunately I got very little sleep as I had to contend with a barking dog two rooms down. All night. First of all what kind of person takes an animal into a hotel and what kind of hotel allows this. If I want to see animals I'll go to a zoo. This was a business trip for God's sake and I'm stuck listening to a freaking barking dog. I would never stay at this hotel again!
reviews.title: Staying at a Kennel

reviews.text: Also the bar was closed on a Thursday night.
reviews.title: I like it

reviews.text: It was my first time at this hotel. We want to go in Boston and Providence during our trip, so we loved the location of the hotel. It's maybe 20 minutes both directions. Really closed to the outlet too.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is really nice, the beds were great and the room was big. We ate the breakfast and it was really good, it's cost like 8$ with orange juice and you have good selections of meals.
reviews.title: Great Wedding with overnight accommodations!

reviews.text: I booked a room on-line and the website went down during payment so I called back 2 days later and the price went up by $30. I called and spoke with the manager, Nate, who immediately took my information and e-mail. He wrote me back, honored the $110 price and provided me with a name to call who would take all my information. First impression...GREAT. When we arrvied, we liked our room but learned they had "outside" rooms with small balconcy. The front-desk person, made another key for us so we could "go look" at the room and decide. This was AFTER we checked into our "interior room." From there it just got better, pool is great for kids. Perfect temperature so nobody complained and we sad with our drinks and watched them swim for hours. Never have to leave the place because there is a great restaruant on site Pikes Peak...very very good food. Kids ate free. Highly recommend this hotel and the staff (all) extremely polite and nice. From housekeeping to waitresses so nice which means they "hire" the right people and train them well. My only complaint...wish I brought my pillow. Pillows are bulky and tough on the neck :)
reviews.title: Wonderful place for a weekend with the kids or Great place to stay after a Patriot's game"

reviews.text: I stayed over President's Day weekend and was pleasantly surprised, one of the best Holiday Inns I've stayed at. The room was spotless, the bed was very comfortable, and the rest of the hotel was attractive. The front desk staff was just great, very helpful. The fitness center is very well equipped for a hotel fitness center. Breakfast at the hotel was great - good food and good service. I ate dinner at the attached restaurant Pike's Peak and although I've seen some negative reviews online, I'd highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable, wonderful staff

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for two nights for the NETRA ( New England Trail Riders Association) banquet. The hotel is actually really nice. I think it has been recently renovated. We stayed in room 191 sort of off to the side near the pool. The room is really nice and big. The heat cranks like crazy which is cool because it is so cold outside. The room has a brand new flat screen TV, huge comfy king bed and clean room and bathroom. They also have free wifi which is a huge plus and it works great. The pool area is really nice with a hot tub. Some of the rooms in the pool area have a balcony. Even though we are close to the pool it is still very quiet and we cant hear a thing from inside our room. The staff is really very nice even though I only had limited interaction with them. The cleaning staff came and we were still sleeping because we were up late and we said we didn't need the room cleaned but they gave us a ton of towesl without even asking. The hotel set up a huge area for the club to set up and display bikes and stuff like that. They also had a huge room where we had the dinner and awards banquet. The food that was served was good and the service were pretty prompt considering there were a ton of people there. We saw some of the rooms that our friends were staying in and they were just as equally as nice as ours and just as clean. The hotel is close to the high way but sort of in an industrial part of the town. This is a really nice hotel and would totally tell people to stay here.
reviews.title: The Holiday Inn-Mansfield
Nice Holiday inn
reviews.text: Nice pool area, and the suites are great with jacuzzis and flat screen tv's

Check in staff were friendly, and mentioned that breakfast was served from x am to x am (can't remember exactly), but did not specify that it was not included in the room rate. I had stayed at a Holiday Inn in another state less than 2 weeks ago and breakfast was included in the room rate that time, so I was very surprised when the breakfast staff stated that I would receive a bill for the meal! The front desk later stated that some room rates include breakfast and others don't. I urge check-in staff to be clear with guests whether breakfast is "free" or costs extra. There was a dead fly in the light fixture over the sink. The heater in the room has an "off" setting which I selected because I am a light sleeper and found the heater to run loudly. I woke up several times overnight when the heater mysteriously clicked on (loudly), blew air for a few seconds, and then shut off. Was too tired to call the front desk and ask for help in the middle of the night.
reviews.title: friendly staff, some problems

description: Voted "Business of the Year" by the Tri-Town Chamber. Holiday Inn Mansfield-Foxboro is a newly decorated hotel with guest experience a top priority. Centrally located between Providence and Boston, we are the ideal hotel for business and leisure travelers. Whether visiting nearby destinations such as Boston, Cape Cod or Plymouth, visiting Wrentham Village Premium Outlets or taking in a concert at the Comcast Center, the Holiday Inn Mansfield-Foxboro hotel is sure to exceed your expectations. We are the closest full service Holiday Inn hotel to Patriot Place at Gillette Stadium, home of the New England Patriots and the NE Revolution. Our extended stay Foxboro area hotel features 202 newly renovated rooms and suites, 19 rooms of meeting space, a grand ballroom, a beautiful atrium courtyard, 2 restaurants, Wi-Fi, Jacuzzi, sauna, indoor pool, and complimentary shuttle service within a 2 mile radius as well as an 8,000 sq. ft. fitness center with aerobics classes. Central to Boston's Logan Airport and TF Green Airport.
